item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Cassandra Clare
Chelsea add a quote by Patrick Süskind
item.description: "Very well, but remember this... I'll be looking at you when you're laid on the cross and the twelve blows are crashing down on your limbs. When the crowd is finally tired of your screams and wandered home, I will climb up through your blood and sit beside you. I will look deep into your eyes... and drop by drop I will trickle my disgust into them like burning acid until... finally... you perish." -- Patrick Süskind

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "You're so easy to tease. And yes, your friend is just fine. Well, except that he keeps putting all my things away and trying to clean up. Now I can't find anything. He's compulsive." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "My rapier wit hides my inner pain." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "I don't want to be a man," said Jace. "I want to be an angst-ridden teenager who can't confront his own inner demons and takes it out verbally on other people instead." "Well," said Luke, "you're doing a fantastic job." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Rick Riordan
item.description: "Families are messy. Immortal families are eternally messy. Sometimes the best we can do is to remind each other that we're related for better or for worse...and try to keep the maiming and killing to a minimum." -- Rick Riordan

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "Is standing by the window muttering about blood something he does all the time?" asked Simon. "No," Jace said. "Sometimes he sits on the couch and does it." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Eric A. Burns
item.description: "Humanity can be quite cold to those who see the world differently." -- Eric A. Burns

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Jeff Valdez
item.description: "Cats are smarter than dogs. You can’t get eight cats to pull a sled through snow." -- Jeff Valdez

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by J.K. Rowling
Chelsea add a quote by Cassandra Clare
Chelsea add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "It wouldn't be my move," Jace agreed. "First the candy and flowers, then the apology letters, then the ravenous demon hordes. In that order." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "Death is a release from the impressions of the senses, and from desires that make us their puppets, and from the vagaries of the mind, and from the hard service of the flesh." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Julian Tuwim
item.description: "There are two kinds of blood, the blood that flows in the veins and the blood that flows out of them. " -- Julian Tuwim

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Jean Rostand
item.description: "Kill a man, and you are a murderer. Kill millions of men, and you are a conqueror. Kill everyone, and you are a god." -- Jean Rostand

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Robert Bloch
item.description: "Despite my ghoulish reputation, I really have the heart of a small boy. I keep it in a jar on my desk." -- Robert Bloch

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "I can be most colorful and inventive when I am angry." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Don't be ridiculous, Charlie, people love the parents who beat their kids in department stores. It's the ones who just let their kids wreak havoc that everybody hates." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Walter Lippmann
item.description: "It requires wisdom to understand wisdom: the music is nothing if the audience is deaf." -- Walter Lippmann

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "We came to see Jace. Is he alright?" "I don't know," Magnus said. "Does he normally just lie on the floor like that without moving?" -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "I have a high pain threshold. In fact, it's more of a large and tastfully decorated foyer than a threshold. But I do get easily bored" -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "I was alive when the Dead Sea was just a lake that was feeling a little poorly." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Memories warm you up from the inside. But they also tear you apart." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Richard Wright
item.description: "I would hurl words into this darkness and wait for an echo, and if an echo sounded, no matter how faintly, I would send other words to tell, to march, to fight, to create a sense of the hunger for life that gnaws in us all." -- Richard Wright

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "And the little screaming fact that sounds through all history: repression works only to strengthen and knit the repressed." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Cassandra Clare
Chelsea add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "Only the very weak-minded refuse to be influenced by literature and poetry." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love." -- Charles M. Schulz
